column4: could someone point me to where i can find libc6-dev, i havnt any internet on the box i'm trying to finish but i need libc6-dev and i cant find it :|
archive.u.c/ubuntu/pool/main/g/glibc/
if you have to ask tho, you want to be very careful, lest you break your system
thank you very much! i been looking for ages :P
why are you compiling a kernel?
because i need to add support for my network card
that's very unlikely to require recompiling the kernel
what card is it?
ummm marvell yukon 88E8036 PCI-E
and why do you think you need to recompile your kernel?

well i was looking for drivers and i found one, but it said i could add it to my source using a patch or compile a module, i tried to compile a module but it said the kernel source wasnt the same as the kernel i was running ( even though it is ) so i thought i would try the other way
no, you can't compile modules against random kernel sources you download from kernel.org
or even against the kernel sources from within ubuntu
i'm running the same kernel as the source i have, they are both ubuntu ones
you, like lynx_nhb, need to compile it (if it is indeed not in the ubuntu kernel already) against the correct kernel headers
yes, you don't compile drivers against random kernel source trees
i also have the kernel headers for the kernel i'm running
then something went wrong with the compile
thats why i thought i would roll my own kernel instead
how would that help?
it would then have the driver inside the kernel so i wouldnt have to make a module for the kernel i;m running
